attributes.action: 2021 GCSEs Should be open book and be allowed to have our notes in the exam
attributes.additional_details: It will benefit they future and the governments future as they will be able to get good qualifications and promote tax will be payed to the government
attributes.background: We want the government to have an open book exam allowing us to take notes into the exam room in GCSES in 2021 as due to COVID-19 there has been a loss of education, this will be fair due to COVID there will be an impact on the future and it will decide what qualifications they receive in college

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament. 

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
